text: Marlène Boissonnault is a Canadian ice hockey goaltender, currently a member of the PWHPA. == Career == Across four years for Cornell, Boissonnault finished with 56 wins, the 2nd highest total in the university's history, and 15 shutouts, the third most in Cornell history.https://cornellbigred.com/sports/womens-ice-hockey/roster/marl-ne- boissonnault/48802 In 2019, the team made the Frozen Four.https://womenshockeylife.com/ncaa-marlene-boissonnault-cornell-big-red/ After she graduated, she joined the PWHPA, as the CWHL had just folded.https://cornellsun.com/2019/05/07/the-suns-female-senior-athlete-of- the-year-hockeys-marlene-boissonnault/ === International === Boissonnault represented Canada at the 2015 IIHF U18 Women’s World Championships, winning a silver medal.https://womenshockeylife.com/ncaa-marlene-boissonnault-cornell- big-red/https://stats.hockeycanada.ca/roster/show/1503234?subseason=197364 In 2017, she was named to the National Women’s Development Team roster.https://www.theicegarden.com/2017/12/12/16765576/hockey-canada-selects- national-womens-development-team-roster-2018-nations-cup == Personal life == Boissonnault has a degree in biology.https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/new- brunswick/elite-nb-goaltender-olympics-1.5428573 ==References== ==External links== * Biographical information and career statistics from Elite Prospect Category:1997 births Category:Living people Category:Ice hockey people from New Brunswick Category:Canadian women's ice hockey goaltenders Category:Cornell Big Red women's ice hockey players Category:Professional Women's Hockey Players Association players
title: Marlène Boissonnault
